view

Class TTTFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • view.TTTFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class TTTFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    This class is an extension of JFrame specifically tailored to a Tic-Tac-Toe game window. It has a TTTMenuBar instance variable, as well as an array of panels representing the squares on a game board.
    Author:
    Theo Davis and Sacha Best
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • TTTFrame

        public TTTFrame(int dimensions,
        TTTMenuBar menuBar)
        This constructor creates a TTTFrame object, setting the default size to 600 x 600 pixels. It also sets the default close operation, the title of the window, the Skin of the panels, and the GridLayout of the panels on the board. Finally, the constructor initializes the instance variables and sets the window visible to the user.
        Parameters:
        dimensions - - the dimensions of the game board.
        menuBar - - the TTTMenuBar to be placed in the window.

    • Method Detail

      • createPanelList

        private TTTPanel[] createPanelList(int newDimensions)
        This method is only called in the constructor to create an array of TTTPanels, each with accurate Location data for use in the "model" by the TTTController. Each panel is created, set visible, and returned in an array.
        Parameters:
        newDimensions - - the new dimensions for when/if the board is resized.
        Returns:
        - an array of TTTPanels with appropriate Locations attached to them.

      • changeSkin

        public void changeSkin(Skin changeTo)
        This method changes the skin of every TTTPanel in the frame.
        Parameters:
        changeTo - - the Skin to be used.

      • reset

        public void reset(int dimensions)
        This method resets the view to an empty grid.
        Parameters:
        dimensions - - the dimensions of the new board.

      • getJMenuBar

        public javax.swing.JMenuBar getJMenuBar()
        Overrides:
        getJMenuBar in class javax.swing.JFrame
        Returns:
        the TTTMenuBar.

      • getDimensions

        public int getDimensions()
        Returns:
        the dimensions of the grid.

      • getPanelList

        public TTTPanel[] getPanelList()
        Returns:
        the array of TTTPanels in the UI.

      • getPanelAt

        public TTTPanel getPanelAt(Location loc)
        This method returns the TTTPanel with the given Location properties. This is only used by the Computer when simulating MouseEvents.
        Parameters:
        loc - - the Location to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the TTTPanel at Location loc, or null if there is not one.
